main event: A cigar-shaped unidentified aerial object was observed on 18 November 1949 at Biloxi, Mississippi, by guards at the Biloxi Veterans Hospital.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be around 200 feet long and 25 feet in diameter, flying at an altitude of 2500 to 3000 feet., The object was sighted for approximately 25 minutes, maintaining a steady flight with no visible means of propulsion or control surfaces., Observers reported no sound from the object during the sighting., The guards who witnessed the object are verified as reliable personnel trained to observe unusual incidents., The object was described as white and reflecting sunlight, and it disappeared from view behind a tree line.
witness description: Guards at the Biloxi Veterans Hospital
